content: as tall as it is wide end after any full row in the pattern finish fasten_off weave in all tails with a yarn needle so your striped heights block is neat and ready to join into the bag okay let s build this bag step by step i ll break it into 3 parts 1 make two panels each panel = 6 blocks 3 wide by 2 tall 2 add top edging + handle to each panel 3 join the two panels to make the bag body i ll also give you 3 different ways to join the squares so you can pick the one you like lay out your squares you have 12 blocks total each side of the bag = 6 blocks layout 3 blocks across and 2 blocks tall do this twice lay out row 1 top row 3 blocks in a line lay out row 2 bottom row 3 blocks in a line under row 1 try to decide which side of each block is the pretty side that will be the outside of your bag pg 23 www hodgepodge-crochet com join the squares into panels 3 methods you are going to join the 3 blocks in row 1 together the 3 blocks in row 2 together then join row 1 to row 2 repeat everything to make a second panel the same way before joining weave in any extra tails that get in the way make sure all pretty sides face the same direction option a whip stitch join with a yarn needle this seam is flat and soft it s nice if you don t want a raised ridge step 1 join the first row of 3 squares 1 take block 1 and block 2 from row 1 2 put them pretty sides together the right sides touching each other 3 line up the edges you want to sew 4 thread a yarn needle with a long piece of yarn 2 3 times the edge length 5 start at one corner 6 insert the needle under the top loops of both blocks and pull the yarn through 7 move to the next stitch and repeat going gently over and over the edge o this is a whip stitch 8 do not pull too tight you want it snug not bunched 9 when you reach the other corner tie off and weave in the tail now do the same to join block 3 to block 2 in row 1 you now have a row of 3 squares step 2 join the second row of 3 squares repeat exactly the same steps for row 2 step 3 join row 1 to row 2 1 lay row 1 and row 2 on top of each other pretty sides together 2 line up the long edges 3 use the same whip stitch all the way across that long edge matching the corners and seams 4 tie off and weave in tails now you have one panel that is
